Evaluate the impact of an integral transformation \\( T(z) = \\int_0^t e^{-s} z(s) \\, ds \\) applied to \\( z(t) \\).

Can we reconstruct the original function \\( z_0(t) \\) over an interval [0, T] from the value of \\( T(z) \\) without knowing whether the transformation \\( T(z) \\) was applied?
Explanation: The transformation \\( T(z) \\) integrates and modifies the original function over the interval, producing a single value or function of time that lacks the information required to uniquely reconstruct \\( z(t) \\) over the entire interval due to the irreversible nature of the integration process.
